meanings.definition: A person or thing that pronates.
meanings.sent1: The pronators in the race were moving quickly.
meanings.sent2: The pronators of the soccer team were skilled at turning their feet inwards.
meanings.sent3: The pronators at the party were spinning around in circles for fun.
meanings.sent4: The pronators of the dance floor twisted and turned like graceful swans.
meanings.sent5: The pronators in the gym class stood out with their unique foot movements.

meanings.definition: A muscle that pronates a limb.
meanings.sent1: The pronators in his arm helped him twist his wrist.
meanings.sent2: The pronators in her leg allowed her to rotate her ankle smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The pronators in the bodybuilding competition flexed proudly on stage.
meanings.sent4: The pronators in the athlete's leg worked tirelessly to support his movements.
meanings.sent5: The pronators in the dancer's foot added a graceful twist to her performance.
